intro: Gymnosporia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, typical of gymnosporangiate structures. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The species is valued for its hardy nature and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
